input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF LEVALLOIS. Summary: Acquisition of Diapers, Hygiene Products and Infant Milk for Early Childhood Establishments in the City and the Levallois School Fund. Description: The purpose of these contracts is the acquisition of diapers, infant milk, wipes, body wash for babies and other hygiene products for the early childhood establishments of the City and the Caisse des Écoles of Levallois. There city ​​of Levallois organizes this procedure as coordinator of the order group formed with the Caisse des Écoles de Levallois. Contracts are subject to the Public Order Code. This document is referred to as the Code in all the documents of the consultation. Qualified as supply contracts, they are subject to the provisions of the CCAG Current Supplies and Services (FCS) approved by Order of March 30, 2021. They are awarded according to the call for tenders procedure. open, subject to the provisions of articles L. 2124-2, R. 2124-2 and R. 2161-1 to 5 of the Code. They constitute framework agreements with purchase orders subject to the provisions of articles L.2125-1 and R.2162-1 to R.2162-6 of the Code. Each contract will be awarded to a single holder for a maximum period of 4 years including renewals. As this is an open procedure, the maximum number of participants is not limited. The maximum total value of the contracts is 752,000 euro(s) excluding VAT, taking into account their duration and possible renewals, with no minimum amount. Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-02-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

In addition, the quality of service is crucial to guarantee the comfort of users of the buildings of the City of Sotteville-lès-Rouen. Thus, the Operator makes every effort to guarantee compliance with the provisions contractual terms mentioned in this contract as well as optimal continuity of service. The contract duration takes into account the duration of the investments to which is added the operation-maintenance period. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF NANCY. Summary: Supply, Delivery and Assembly of School, Extracurricular and Catering Furniture for the City of Nancy.. Description: The City of Nancy has 44 public schools, including 22 nursery schools, 21 elementary schools and 1 primary school, to accommodate approximately 5,500 students. These students eat lunch in the 35 school restaurants available in the City. The City is responsible for equipping classes and activity spaces with furniture, as well as school restaurants with catering furniture. The services consist of the supply, delivery and assembly of furniture for nursery schools and elementary schools of public schools in the City of Nancy. They also include the removal of existing furniture.. Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-21. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CTÉ CNES LA DOMITIENNE. Summary: Supply, Service and Maintenance of the Information System Infrastructure and an Outsourced Messaging Solution. Description: The main IS infrastructure of the La Domitienne community is hosted at the headquarters. It is based on an architecture based on 1 physical server hosting virtual machines and a NAS for backup. Some remote sites have also local infrastructure. The server infrastructure in place at headquarters is reaching the end of its life and no longer meets the requirements of the La Domitienne community in terms of performance and security. In this context, the Community of La Domitienne commune wishes to renew its headquarters server infrastructure in order to meet its current and future challenges. The purpose of this framework agreement is therefore: - The supply of equipment and software allowing the implementation of the architecture server - Migration of existing data and applications (VM) to the new architecture - Provision of an outsourced messaging solution (antispam) - Provision of a supervision and administration solution - All services specification and physical and logical integration allowing the implementation of the target solution - Preventive, corrective and evolutionary maintenance of hardware and software implemented as part of the consultation Supply, service and maintenance of the Information System infrastructure and an outsourced messaging solution Doc Title: Supply, service and maintenance of the Information System infrastructure and a.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: HUS-GHT 10 SUPPORT ESTABLISHMENT. Summary: Acquisition and Deployment of Four-Module Software - Perioperative Medicine for the University Hospitals of Strasbourg. Description: The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. The services are regulated by unit and fixed prices. The estimated amounts are indicative and include all renewal periods. The market is made for the account of the HUS. The FHU DATA-SURGE aims to improve care before, during and after surgical operations by applying new data science techniques to their richest data aggregates, as generated by the latest generations of electronic medical records and connected monitoring devices. The aim of this scientific approach is to analyze the large quantities of data collected during surgical interventions in order to improve our knowledge of the state of health of operated patients. Clinical applications sought include optimizing care for surgical patients. These optimizations could make it possible to improve the state of health after an operation, to make the experience hospital experience more pleasant, and to make the entire healthcare system more efficient. The FHU brings together the expertise of doctors, researchers, computer scientists and data security specialists and patient representatives who are essential to these goals. It emphasizes collaboration between clinicians, biostatisticians and machine learning researchers to maximize the potential of health data. The project includes initiatives.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The coordinator is Grand Besançon Métropole The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. Each lot will be awarded separately. Lot 1 will be awarded to a maximum of 3 economic operators (subject to a sufficient number of offers) and lots 2, 3 and 4 to a single economic operator. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: LOIRE ATLANTIQUE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Reconstruction of the Auguste Mailloux College in Loroux-Bottereau. Description: Each lot will be awarded separately. Services are paid by fixed prices. The departmental college plan, updated in 2019, highlighted the need to rebuild the Auguste Mailloux college in Loroux-Bottereau. THE future establishment, with a capacity of 28 divisions, will be rebuilt on a plot directly adjoining the current college. The establishment will include an educational inclusion unit (ULIS), premises intended for administration, teachers, a center health, maintenance premises as well as 3 staff accommodation. External developments necessary for the proper functioning of the establishment will complete this reconstruction: access, forecourt, parking. In total, the surface area is estimated at 4,700 m² of useful surfaces. Old buildings will be deconstructed and asbestos removed The portion of the financial envelope allocated to the work is 14,997,100 euro(s) excluding tax (value September 2023). Delivery of the new college (teaching building-phase 1) is planned for the start of the 2028 school year. At the end of the various stages of demolition-asbestos removal then reconstruction, the overall completion of the operation will take place in the first quarter of 2030 VRD-Road Networks Miscellaneous Big work Frame Waterproofing Cover Facade coverings Exterior joinery Locksmith Partitions / Linings False ceilings Interior joinery Floor coverings Painting / Cleaning Heating Ventilation Plumbing Electricity CFO / CF.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERCOMMUNAL COMMUNITY NORTH REUNION. Summary: Supply and Maintenance of Cinor Garbage Bins. Description: The contract consists of: FIRM SECTION: - The supply of garbage bins intended for the collection of residual household waste, recyclable waste, and bio-waste (lots 1 and 2). - Maintenance of the trash bin fleet, belonging to CINOR (lots 1 and 2). - The temporary provision of garbage bins (lots 1 and 2). - The recovery and recycling of used bins (lots 1 and 2). - Computerized management of the container fleet (lots 1 and 2). - Call management and recording, and the organization of deliveries (lots 1 and 2). OPTIONAL TRANCHES (TO): - TO NO1 (lots 1 and 2): Chipping campaigns. - TO NO2 (lots 1 and 2): Staffing analyzes and surveys with a view to preventive maintenance or updating/adjustments of staffing on all or part of the park. - TO NO3 (lot 2): Supply, installation and maintenance of bio-waste bin shelters. The estimated value and the maximum value of the framework agreement mentioned in section 2.1.3 of this notice are those of the cumulative amount of lots 1 and 2 over the total duration of the contract (4 years).. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SAINTE-MAXIME. Summary: Complete Renovation of the Positive Cold Production of the Central Kitchen. Description: The project consists of carrying out a complete renovation of the positive cold production of the municipal central kitchen of Sainte-Maxime. The intervention aims to completely replace the existing installation operating on R448A, which has become obsolete, with one new installation operating with HFO R1234yf fluid, classified A2L, compliant with the future obligations of the F-Gas III regulations. The installation must make it possible to continuously ensure the required temperature levels in the various refrigeration rooms, without significant interruption of activity in the central kitchen. The services will be remunerated by application of the overall fixed price as specified in the breakdown of the overall and fixed price, which will be reported in the act of commitment when of the attribution COMPLETE RENOVATION OF THE POSITIVE COLD PRODUCTION OF THE CENTRAL KITCHEN The project consists of carrying out a complete renovation of the positive cold production of the municipal central kitchen of Sainte-Maxime. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SEMOP TRANSPORT OF THE EUROMETROPOLIS OF METZ. Summary: Sourcing as Part of the Project to Acquire Electric Buses with their Pantograph or Flash Fast Charging System to Replace the Current 24M Hybrids. Description: As part of its energy transition strategy and the evolution of its BHNS lines, Transport de l'Eurométropole de Metz (which takes over, on January 1, 2026, from Transport de l'Agglomération de Metz Métropole (TAMM)), is launching a phase of sourcing aimed at identifying manufacturers capable of supplying 100% electric buses of 18 m and 24 m, as well as charging solutions adapted to operation in High Level of Service Bus (BHNS) mode. The objectives of sourcing are following: - Evaluate the maturity of the 18 m and 24 m electric bus solutions available or in the process of being approved. - Know the technical, industrial and logistical conditions of production. - Anticipate risks and optimization levers to successful integration on METTIS lines. The vehicles concerned by the sourcing are 100% electric articulated buses of 18 m and 24 m: - Compliance with European standards and urban integration constraints (templates, ramps, radius of gyration). - Passenger capacity adapted to the needs of METTIS lines (Nb Passenger / rate). - Performance in real operating conditions (autonomy, consumption, reliability). Information on charging solutions: - Charging systems depot, at terminus and online (pantograph, OppCharge, CCS2, etc.). - Integration of energy infrastructures (power, cycles, depot interfaces). - Partnerships with integrators for a solution.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The market concerns the installation of batteries and the potential operation and maintenance of a storage project in Variscourt (Hauts-de-France region). The storage facility has the following characteristics: - Battery capacity: 95 MWh - Battery power: 47.5 MW - Technology: LFP (lithium iron phosphate) - Project duration: 25 years - COD: Q1/2028 Execution part: The contractor must provide and install the lithium iron phosphate batteries and, if applicable, the inverter and transformer that meet the technical specifications and safety standards of EDF Power Solutions. Operation - Maintenance part: The operation and maintenance of the site will be based on a contract with a maximum duration of 25 years. The contractor must take into account all the technical characteristics of the project related to the execution phase. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CIVILIAN. Summary: Relaunch of Lot N°5 of the Cybersecurity Services and Tools Market: Identity Management Software in Active Directory and Bastion Software. Description: The purpose of this contract is to implement Cybersecurity services and solutions: - Lot n°1: Identity management software in Active Directory? - Lot n°2: Bastion software. This concerns the relaunch of lot no. 5 of the services market and of cybersecurity tools, following an unsuccessful attempt. CIVIS wishes to implement an identity and access management (IAM) solution offering multi-factor authentication (MFA) for Active Directory, single sign-on (SSO), Contextual access controls and simple and efficient session management. The solution must be a SAAS solution in CAPEX mode in advance over 3 years. It should make it possible to organize the governance of the security of the CIVIS IS by a combination of processes ensured and executed by the governing body. It must enable the management of risks which could prevent the achievement of the objectives of CIVIS. Finally, it must enable the management of compliance of policies, procedures, laws and regulations of the CIVIS (NIS2). CIVIS wishes to set up a Bastion d'administration or PAM (Privileged Access Management) solution certified by ANSSI, to supervise, control, trace and protect its network and its servers from access to privileges. Doc Title: Relaunch of lot n°5 of the cybersecurity services and tools market: Identity management software in Active Directory and Bastion Software Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GRAND EAST REGION. Summary: Supply and Installation of Multimedia Equipment for Educational Establishments in the Grand Est Region, the European Community of Alsace and the Meuse Department as Well as for The. Description: The contract subject to the consultation aims for the acquisition and installation of multimedia equipment for public high schools in the Grand Est Region and public middle schools in the European Community of Alsace (CeA) and the Department of Meuse, i.e. 406 educational establishments as well as for the needs of internal services in the Grand Est Region. In this context, the Region, the CeA and the Meuse department have come together in a group of orders of which the Grand Est Region is the coordinator. The market aims at the acquisition and (possible) installation of multimedia equipment: video projectors and screens, printers, viewers, speakers, accessories and software licenses... as well as training. Furthermore, subsequent contracts may be concluded to meet all new needs, particularly in the context of the implementation of systems linked to hybridization* and materials and accessories for calls for academic projects around Nomad TVs and video capture. For keep the stock of educational establishments up to date, the Grand Est Region replaces around 900 aging equipment per year; the CeA replaces around 200 to 500 aging equipment per year, and the Meuse Department replaces (since 2023) its entire video projector fleet (approximately 500), at the speed of approximately 100 video projectors per year (this replacement program should end in December 2027). The contract will be concluded in the form of an agreement.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF SAINT-GERMAIN-EN-LAYE. Summary: Various Services for the Organization of the Fête Des Loges. Description: This framework agreement covers various services for the organization of the Fête des Loges. The Fête des Loges is a fairground event which takes place annually during the summer period. It is held at the location: Esplanade des Loges . Lot 2: Water network installation and management services The framework agreement consists of installing the water supply to the various bungalows and caravans of the Fête des Loges during the event. Lot 3: Office of control of facilities The framework agreement consists of verifying various installations located on the Esplanade des Loges by an approved inspection office. The festival includes 132 locations including 7 restaurants, 8 refreshment bars and 8 candy stores. These figures may vary from year to year. They will be provided to the service provider each year before the start of his mission. Lot 4: Removal, maintenance and reinstallation of safety barriers and/or concrete separators The annual service consists of the removal, maintenance and refitting of crash barriers and/or concrete separators. Doc Title: Various services for the organization of the Fête des Loges Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GRAND EST REGION. Summary: Supply and Installation of Multimedia Equipment for Educational Establishments in the Grand Est Region, the European Community of Alsace and the Meuse Department as Well as for The.... Description: Supply and installation of multimedia equipment for educational establishments in the Grand Est Region, the European Community of Alsace and the Meuse department as well as for the... The market subject of the consultation aims at the acquisition and the installation of multimedia equipment for public high schools in the Grand Est Region and public middle schools in the European Community of Alsace (CeA) and the Meuse Department, i.e. 406 educational establishments as well as for the needs of internal services of the Grand Est Region. In this context, the Region, the CeA and the Meuse department have come together in a group of orders of which the Grand Est Region is the coordinator. The contract aims at the acquisition and (possible) installation multimedia equipment: video projectors and screens, printers, viewers, speakers, accessories and software licenses... as well as training. Furthermore, subsequent contracts may be concluded to meet any new needs, particularly in the context of the implementation of systems linked to hybridization* and materials and accessories for calls for academic projects around Nomad TVs and video capture. To keep the stock of educational establishments up to date, the Grand Est Region replaces around 900 aging equipment per year; the CeA replaces around 200 to 500 aging pieces of equipment per year, and the Meuse Department replaces (since 2023) its entire video projector fleet (around 500), at the speed of approximately 100 video projectors per year (this replacement program is expected to end in December 2027). The contract will be concluded in the form of an agreement.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: This is an open call for tenders pursuant to articles L2124-2, R2124-2, 1° and R2161-2 to R2161-5 of the Public Order Code. It is executed gradually the issuance of purchase orders under the conditions set out in articles R. 2162-13 and R. 2162-14 of the public procurement code. For all lots, the framework agreement is concluded without minimum and with maximum expressed in quantity for their entire duration. validity within the meaning of article R2162-4, 2° of the public procurement code. The maximum quantities are defined for the entire duration of the public market in Appendix 1 of the CCTP Catalog of Requirements. For all lots, the public market is single-awarded. The public contract is processed at unit prices set in the unit price schedule (BPU) and in the catalog of the holder of the lot concerned. All supplies that can be ordered are described in the specific technical clauses (CCTP) and in the catalog of the holder of the lot concerned. The estimated quantities of the public contract are given in Annex 1 of the RC Table of quantities. These quantities have no contractual value. They are only used for analyzing offers. The validity period of offers is set at SEVEN (7) months from the deadline for receipt of offers.. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GIP FRANCE PROTECTED CHILDREN. Summary: Supply, Implementation, Maintenance and Operation of an it Solution for Archiving Data from the Lisa Application. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to acquire a solution allowing the archiving of data contained in the LISA application. LISA is the SNATED-119 business application used by SNATED teams to manage calls (telephone calls, chats and forms), draw up a report of the situations and, depending on the situation, transmit it to the departments for evaluation and local treatment of the situation. The consultation also concerns the recovery of data existing assets as well as the maintenance of this solution, which must be able to adapt to developments in the LISA application. The consultation will give rise to a single-award framework agreement with a fixed part concerning the supply of the software specific and a part with purchase orders concerning maintenance (application and scalable). The procedure is concluded without a minimum amount but with a maximum amount of: 221,000 euros excluding tax for all periods combined. The market provides for a duration linked to development, in particular the recovery of data, and the implementation of the software, then a duration linked to the maintenance of the software. The duration of market development will be proposed by the holder in its offer. Then the maintenance part with purchase orders will be notified for a period of 12 months, renewable a maximum of 3 times. This consultation is not the subject of an allotment.. Published Date: 2025-12-20. Closing Date: 2026-01-29. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Supply, Implementation, Maintenance and Operation of an it Solution for Archiving Data from the Lisa Application

LISA is the SNATED-119 business application used by SNATED teams to manage calls (telephone calls, chats and forms), draw up a report of the situations and, depending on the situation, transmit it to the departments for evaluation and local treatment of the situation. The consultation also concerns the recovery of data existing assets as well as the maintenance of this solution, which must be able to adapt to developments in the LISA application. The consultation will give rise to a single-award framework agreement with a fixed part concerning the supply of the software specific and a part with purchase orders concerning maintenance (application and scalable). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SNCF NETWORK. Summary: Development / Supply and Mco Market for 6Th Generation Hot Box Detectors (Dbc 6). Description: The DBC System is a system that helps reduce the risk of derailment caused by damage to the rolling stock (axle box) or the risk of triggering embankment fires caused by an applied brake. To accomplish this mission, the DBC system monitors the temperature of the axle boxes and detects applied brakes when passing traffic. The DBC 6 Development, Supply and Maintenance in Operational Condition contract constitutes a building block of the overall monitoring project. Trains en Marche (STEM) from SNCF Réseau. It concerns a new generation of DBC, DBC 6, intended to replace or complement the generations of DBC currently deployed by SNCF Réseau on the National Rail Network. The DBC 6 market is made up of two Specifications and two Contracts, for a total duration of 27 years maximum, broken down as follows: •a Development and Supply Services Contract for systems and subsystems, for a maximum duration of 17 years (12 firm years and 5 years optional), including in particular the following services: -piloting, management and coordination of the project, -System and subsystem development, -implementation of an on-site SNCF Réseau certification platform, -establishment of a reduced platform simulation, -implementation of a workshop repair platform, -implementation of a maintenance training platform, -training in the installation of equipment, -workshop repair training.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CEA GRENOBLE. Summary: Supply of Deep Engraving Equipment. Description: CEA-LETI wishes to acquire 200 mm equipment with a 200 mm deep silicon etching chamber. The silicon deep etch chamber must be able to perform Bosch and non-Bosch Si etch processes, be gas compatible fluorinated and carry out the etching through the wafer. This equipment must be able to process different types of substrates in automatic mode, without modification or material change: bonded wafers (silicon on SOG glass and silicon on silicon), pads of different thicknesses, pads with organic layers on the back and pads with engraved cavities on the back. The tool must be equipped with an OES end-of-process detection system, an insert beveled edge protection system and an end-of-process detection system for Via Reveal engraving. The segment of passenger vehicles brings together 417 units, of which more than 125 are electric. Van utility vehicles The vehicle fleet of the City of Angers and Angers Loire Métropole has more than 938 vehicles, including 819 light vehicles. This project is part of an ANRU district and must meet mandatory dates and execution conditions such as economic integration clauses with the companies in charge. of the work (the batches concerned are detailed in the DCE documents including article 13 of the CCAP). The school group will ultimately be composed of a kindergarten with 6 classrooms, an elementary school with 10 classes and an after-school school with 4 activity rooms and a catering area as well as an office. The operation will take place in different phases with a schedule providing for: a temporary move from kindergarten to after-school activities for the 2027 winter holidays (February 2027) a temporary move of elementary into after-school and commissioning of kindergarten for winter holidays 2028 (February 2028) elementary move-in for winter break 2029 (February 2029) a move into the extracurricular completed in April 2029. The duration of the work will therefore be 41 months (including the preparation period). The description of the work, the works, their technical specifications as well as a timetable.... Summary: Acquisition, Delivery, Assembly and Installation of School, Extracurricular and Extracurricular Furniture for the City of Décines-Charpieu. Description: This consultation concerns the acquisition, delivery, assembly and installation of school, extracurricular and extracurricular furniture according to the conditions established in the consultation documents. The town of Décines-Charpieu inaugurates in 2026 a new outdoor center and wishes to equip it with furniture (activity room furniture, rest room and catering furniture, etc.). This contract also concerns the renewal of the furniture of the various school groups in the City (furniture of nursery and elementary classes, catering furniture, etc.). This is a single-award framework agreement with purchase orders, concluded for an initial period of one year and tacitly renewable three times, for periods of one year each. It is concluded without minimum amount and with the following maximum annual amounts: 110,000 euro(s) excluding tax (1st year) / 50,000 euro(s) excluding tax (2nd year) / 30,000 euro(s) excluding tax (3rd year) / 30,000 euro(s) excluding tax (4th year). Summary: Purchase of Household Appliances, Sound and Images, Intended for the Services of the Departments of Bouches-Du-Rhône.. Description: This consultation concerns the purchase of household appliances, sound and images, intended for the services of the Departments of Bouches-du-Rhône. The Purchasing, Equipment, Supplies and Moving Department (SAGEFD) of the Services Department General (DSG) is responsible for the purchase of supplies, equipment and services allowing the Directorates of the Department to have the necessary means to enable them to fulfill their missions. The types of equipment concerned by this market may include in a non-exhaustive manner: - Consumer or professional type household appliances (heating/air conditioning, cooking, small household appliances, etc.). - Sound and Image (headphones, TV) for the general public. - Any accessories and consumables associated with the families above. The framework agreement is concluded with a minimum annual amount of €10,000 excluding tax and a maximum annual amount of €100,000 excluding tax. Location(s) of execution: various sites in the Bouches-du-Rhône Department (see CCTP appendix).. Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ELECTRICITY TRANSMISSION NETWORK (RTE). Summary: 24901 - Renewal of the Supply of Weather Stations and Associated Services. Description: To cover all the needs for the supply of sensors and associated data acquisition services for the industrialization of DLR (Dynamic Line Rating) solutions, RTE set up a framework market in June 2025. These DLR systems allow, based on one or more parameters measured in the field, to determine a dynamic transit capacity which then replaces the IST/IT values ​​(Temporary Backup Intensity / Overload Intensities) in the management and study tools. This dynamic transit capacity is also referred to by the acronym ampacity (for ampere capacity). The objective is to free up additional margins on the works to remove certain constraints or to manage them differently by optimizing the parades. To do this, the MyDLR solution requires deploying temporary weather stations for a period of two years. This data is then used to train a learning model capable of estimating transit capacities only at from weather forecasts. Once the model is trained, the stations can be removed and reused on other airlines. A descriptive document of the project will be available on the BRAVOSOLUTION platform. Renewal of the supply of weather stations and associated services To cover all needs for the supply of sensors and associated data acquisition services for the industrialization of DLR (Dynamic Line Ra) solutions.... Published Date: 2025-12-18. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: THE POST OFFICE. Summary: Supply and Integration of a Data Extraction, Transformation and Loading Solution and Associated Services. Description: The IT Services Department (i-TEAM Department) of La Poste wishes to acquire a software solution for extracting, transforming and loading data in SaaS or Hybrid mode and associated services. The solution will be sent to La Poste and will cover firm services on the deployment of the solution and optional services, detailed below. The language of the proposed solution and services (support, training, etc.) must be in French. The exchanges are will be exclusively in French. The application must comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The processing of personal data of La Poste, including hosting, storage and/or consultation must must be located within the European Union (EU), a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), or a country recognized as suitable by the European Union. The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. Supply and integration of a solution for extracting, transforming and loading data.... Published Date: 2025-12-17. Closing Date: 2026-01-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CURIE INSTITUTE. Summary: Renovation of the Curie Institute in Saint-Cloudlots 2,5,7 and 11. Description: The purpose of this contract is to carry out renovation work on several areas representing approximately 4,000m² within the Institut Curie on the Saint Cloud site. The works operation constitutes a contract divided into 11 lots. The main procedure planned for the rehabilitation operation is the open call for tenders. Nevertheless, the buyer plans to use an adapted open procedure with the possibility of negotiation (MAPA) for certain lots of limited amount, in accordance with the provisions of Article R.2123-1 of the Public Procurement Code. Only lots 2, 5, 7 and 11 are affected by this adapted open procedure with the possibility of negotiation (MAPA). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SDEC ENERGY. Summary: Supply of Pre-Wired, Zhaga D4I Certified Painted Led Luminaires for Road or Residential Lighting. Description: This framework agreement concerns the supply of painted, pre-wired, Zhaga D4i certified LED luminaires, associated with either a remote personal protection surge protector or a remote surge protector, for lighting roadways or residential The estimated, non-contractual quantities are 3,000 units per year. The materials proposed must make it possible to achieve the levels required for satisfactory lighting while respecting the black frame in CALVADOS and to offer the conditions of the RES EC 104 sheet for obtaining CEE ( - the power supply auxiliaries and the LED module can be replaced; - in the event of installation of a new luminaire, the luminaire has a degree of protection (IP) of at least 65 - the LED modules with a color temperature greater than or equal to 2,500 K have a luminous efficiency at 50% of the nominal luminous flux (i.e. at full load) inclusive greater than or equal to 135 lumens per watt; - LED modules with a color temperature strictly lower than 2,500 K have a luminous efficiency at 50% of the nominal luminous flux (i.e. at full load) inclusive greater than or equal to 110 lumens per watt; - the lifespan announced for L90B50 of the LED module is greater than or equal to 100,000 hours; - the equipment auxiliary has a mortality rate at 100,000 hours less than or equal to 10%.) input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PROVENCE-ALPES-CÔTE D-AZUR REGION. Summary: Acquisition of Office Furniture for Services in the Provence-Alpes-Côte D'Azur Region and Associated Services. Description: The consultation is launched in the form of an open call for tenders in accordance with articles R2161-2 to R2161-5 and R.2162.1 et seq. of the public procurement code. The framework agreements will be concluded with a single economic operator in accordance with articles R.2162-2 et seq. of the Public Procurement Code. They will be executed, in accordance with article R.2162-3 of the public procurement code, in part by: - ​​The issuance of purchase orders, for the services provided for in the unit price schedule (BPU) and in the catalog falling within the scope of the framework agreement in compliance with articles R.2162-13 and R.2162-14 - The conclusion of subsequent contracts, for services not provided for in the BPU or in the catalog, in compliance with articles R.2162-7 to R.2162-12. These contracts will specify the characteristics and methods of execution of the services concerned. These include specific services or furniture, which are difficult to predict or cannot be identified in advance due to their technicalities. THE services are divided into 3 lots which will be the subject of separate contracts. Candidates can bid for all lots. There are no plans to break it down into sections. Published Date: 2025-12-16. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Acquisition of Office Furniture for Services in the Provence-Alpes-Côte D'Azur Region and Associated Services

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DEPARTMENT OF DORDOGNE. Summary: Supplies of Dematerialized Restaurant Tickets for Agents of the Dordogne Departmental Council. Description: The purpose of this contract is the supply, delivery and management of electronic meal vouchers for agents of the Dordogne Departmental Council (excluding family assistants and children's village agents). The service includes: - the supply and delivery of dematerialized restaurant vouchers. - the provision of an IT solution for managing restaurant voucher orders (WEB ordering tool). - access to a personal beneficiary account via an online platform secure and an application. It is concluded in the form of a framework agreement with purchase orders with a maximum quantity set at 1,497,200 restaurant vouchers per year. It lasts for one year and is renewable 3 times tacitly. A phase is planned preparatory prior to the implementation of the service. This preparatory phase will begin upon notification of the framework agreement. During this phase, lasting a maximum of 8 weeks, the incumbent must: - Configure the command tool in line, - Configure the cards, - Place a test order (menu and restaurant vouchers) The first order must be able to be carried out in June 2026: loading of the cards in the month of June 2026 (working days in the month of May 2026) SUPPLIES OF DEMATERIALIZED RESTAURANT TICKETS FOR AGENTS OF THE DORDOGNE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL The purpose of this contract is the supply, delivery and management of dematerialized restaurant vouchers for agents.... The framework agreements will be concluded with a single economic operator in accordance with articles R.2162-2 et seq. of the Public Procurement Code. They will be executed, in accordance with article R.2162-3 of the public procurement code, in part by: - The issuance of purchase orders, for the services provided for in the unit price schedule (BPU) and in the catalog falling within the scope of the framework agreement in compliance with articles R.2162-13 and R.2162-14 - The conclusion of subsequent contracts, for services not provided for in the BPU or the catalogue, in compliance with articles R.2162-7 to R.2162-12. These contracts will specify the characteristics and methods of execution of the services concerned. These include specific services or furniture, which are difficult to predict or cannot be identified in advance due to their technicalities. THE services are divided into 3 lots which will be the subject of separate contracts. Candidates can bid for all lots. This framework agreement concerns project management missions, such as as defined in articles R. 243-1 et seq. and in appendix 20 of the Public Procurement Code (decree of March 22, 2019), as well as accessibility study and traffic study missions (counting, floating car data and traffic modeling) Lot n°1 -Project management missions for mobility infrastructure projects This lot concerns support for the study and project management with a view to creating developments and infrastructures for sustainable mobility, for which the Savoie Mont-Blanc Ecomobility Agency is Assistant to the Project Owner. The Project Owner will be one of the shareholder communities of the SPL Agence Ecomobilité Savoie Mont-Blanc. The developments will mainly be cycle facilities (path cycle path, green lane), road developments allowing easier insertion of the cycle (road with unmarked central lane, zone 30, cycle lanes, etc.), pedestrian developments (meeting zone, sidewalk), carpooling arrangements (drop-off), crossing structures (pedestrian/cycle tunnels, footbridges). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SNCF NETWORK. Summary: Supply of Gtc Ng Equipment. Description: The project mentioned is called: GTC v2 or NG. Its objective is to supervise telecom equipment on a national scale, with the centralization of information. Network coverage constraints are a key point of our project. Due to the geographical location of Telecom buildings and their associated activities, some are connected to SNCF networks such as SIRIUS and INFRACOM, others are not at all. To do this, the supply purchasing file concerns the purchase of sensors wired and non-wired. These sensors are of the following types: Temperature probe, Water detection, Smoke detection, Gas detection, Door opening detection. To be monitorable, we need an IoT/wireless gateway. In this sense, the choice a solution that is both wired and non-wired is necessary to overcome environmental constraints and benefit from supervision throughout the national territory. SNCF reserves the right to install one or the other solution depending on the local constraints. Supply of GTC NG equipment The project mentioned is called: GTC v2 or NG. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PARIS AIRPORTS. Summary: Design and Implementation Process to Increase the Capacity of the Cdgval Transport System at the Paris-Charles De Gaulle Airport Platform. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to award a design/construction contract with a view to increasing the capacity of the CDGVAL transport system at the Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport platform. Indeed, in order to adapt the demand for the intra-platform transport offer, Aéroports de Paris wishes to award a design/construction contract to increase the storage and transport capacities of the CDGVAL automatic public transport system at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport currently in operation, while perpetuating the current system. Thus, the services envisaged consist of optimizing and adding functionalities to the existing system, whose technical and functional characteristics are based on software, protocols, hardware and interfaces developed by the SIEMENS company. Indeed, the passenger carrying capacity must be increased to cope with forecasts of increased user flows, it will be necessary to achieve in particular: 1/ The construction of 3 additional storage lanes in the CDGVAL workshop garage including, among other things, the guideway, driving automation and traction energy perimeters. 2/ Adaptation of the existing automation system of the line to take into account: a/The need to increase carrying capacities; b/ the integration of trains transferred from LISA to the CDGVAL line into the network. c/ The new storage routes. 3/ The potential adaptation of.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2025-12-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SARREGUEMINES. Summary: Global Public Energy Performance Contract Relating to the Rental with Option to Purchase and the Operation and Maintenance of Public Lighting Equipment. Description: The City of Sarreguemines has decided to undertake an energy renovation operation for its existing public lighting fleet. In this context, the City is considering the conclusion of a Global Performance Market aimed at the installation of equipment high-quality public lighting, integrating a remote management device for each light point. This approach is based on the use of innovative technologies to ensure: - increased energy sobriety, - a notable reduction in the costs of operation (management, maintenance, operation), - and an overall improvement in the technical performance of the installations. The offers presented by the candidates must guarantee an optimal balance between energy sobriety, security and attractiveness. urban, while integrating the communication and consultation aspects necessary to inform the City and its citizens. This orientation is broken down into four priority areas: - Reduction of light pollution and preservation of biodiversity, - Optimization of electrical energy consumption, meeting a dual ecological and economic objective, - Deployment of advanced technologies (LED lighting, remote management systems), - Improvement of technical performances, including the renovation of assets, limiting the risks of breakdowns or disasters, and improving the living environment. Summary: Acquisition and Installation of Equipment and Accessories for Car Bodywork Painter Training Courses at the Lycée Blaise Pascal in Forbach (57). Description: The contract subject of the consultation aims at the acquisition and installation of equipment and accessories for the preparation and application of automobile paints concerning the automobile bodywork painter training courses at the Lycée Blaise Pascal in FORBACH. The project consists of upgrading the technical platform of the AT1 workshop at the Lycée Blaise Pascal, following the transfer of training from the Hurlevent Professional High School in Behren-lès-Forbach, which will close in July 2027. The market includes the supply, delivery, installation and putting into working order of equipment and accessories, recovery of packaging as well as associated on-site training of supervisory user personnel. The paint booth, preparation area 2 stations with heated compensation, the sanding vacuum central connected to 6 multi-energy satellites and the equipment of a preparation and cleaning laboratory are intended for the training of high school students, apprentices, students and interns of continuing education of the following courses: CAP specialty Automotive Painter and Professional Baccalaureate specialty Automotive Bodywork Painter and any other course in the fields of paint preparation and application automobile. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DALKIA CENTER WEST (37). Summary: Clea Heat Network - St Herblain - Exchangers. Description: Additional market information: CLEA, a subsidiary of DALKIA, is the concessionaire for a heating network serving the Bellevue, Dervallières and ATLANTIS districts in Nantes/St Herblain (10,000 housing equivalents). The CLEA network is made up of three main branches: NORTH, SOUTH, EXTENSION, and a gas boiler / biomass boiler connection. The work involves the creation of a new heat recovery room in a wastewater treatment plant in Saint-Herblain, STEU Tougas. The market concerns the design, supply and transport of heat recovery exchangers to be installed in a dedicated premises. Two exchangers with a unit power of 2800 kW are planned. These exchangers must have a pinch of 2°C and fit into the planned premises (dimensions 11x9m ceiling height 4.5m). Given the nature of the water (waste water leaving the treatment plant), the exchangers must be able to be completely cleaned in place by a typical high-pressure manual washing system. Karcher. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF COMMUNITIES OF THE GUEBWILLER REGION (CCRG). Summary: Supply and Implementation of Automated Systems for Upgrading the Remote Management of Sites External to the Steu. Description: The purpose of this contract is to upgrade remote management equipment in anticipation of the removal of RTC, 2G and 3G lines. It includes: • the purchase, supply and installation of equipment (programmable industrial controllers, data loggers, 4G/5G communication equipment), • associated electrical and cabling work, • integration into existing Topkapi type supervision, • creation or updating of synoptics, • implementation of work laws validated by the Agency of Rhine-Meuse Water, • cybersecurity and regulatory compliance (self-monitoring). The contract concerns 27 lifting stations and 19 storm spillways (including 13 to be re-equipped) across the entire CCRG territory.. Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GRAND EAST REGION. Summary: Acquisition and Installation of Equipment and Accessories for Car Bodywork Painter Training Courses at the Lycée Blaise Pascal in Forbach (57). Description: The contract subject of the consultation aims at the acquisition and installation of equipment and accessories for the preparation and application of automobile paints concerning the automobile bodywork painter training courses at the Lycée Blaise Pascal in FORBACH. The project consists of upgrading the technical platform of the AT1 workshop at the Lycée Blaise Pascal, following the transfer of training from the Hurlevent Professional High School in Behren-lès-Forbach, which will close in July 2027. The contract includes the supply, delivery, installation and putting into working order of equipment and accessories, recovery of packaging as well as associated on-site training of supervisory user personnel. The paint booth, preparation area 2 stations with heated compensation, the sanding vacuum central connected to 6 multi-energy satellites and the equipment of a preparation and cleaning laboratory are intended for the training of high school students, apprentices, students and interns of continuing education of the following courses: CAP specialty Automotive Painter and Professional Baccalaureate specialty Automotive Bodywork Painter and any other course in the fields of paint preparation and application automobile. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL CENTER FOR SPACE STUDIES. Summary: Integration of a Monitoring, Management and Control System for the Energy Distribution Network at the Guiana Space Center. Description: This contract concerns the project to implement a monitoring, management and control system for the energy distribution network of the Guyanese space center. It covers the technical scope of the services expected within the framework of the operational implementation of the Smart Grid system developed by the CEA for the CNES. The source code and its software have been specifically designed to meet the constraints of resilience, energy optimization and interoperability with the technical environment of the base. This phase aims to ensure deployment, configuration, functional integration with existing systems, and effective commissioning. This consultation is financed by funds from the European Space Agency and therefore complies with geographic return requirements as described in the consultation file. Integration of an Energy management system This contract concerns the project of implementing a system of monitoring, management and control of the energy distribution network of the Guyanese space center. It covers the technical scope of the services expected as part of the operational implementation of the Smart Grid system developed by the CEA for the CNES. Doc Title: Integration of a monitoring, management and control system for the Energy distribution network at the Guiana Space Center Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-12. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOULOUSE METROPOLIS. Summary: 25Mc0444Aoo_Mhd_As_Supply of Workstations, Printing Means, Miscellaneous Digital Materials. Description: The contract covers the supply of IT equipment: computer stations, screens, printers, peripherals, accessories, consumables, software necessarily attached to the hardware (OS), and hardware warranty. These services must make it possible to cover all manufacturers present on the market. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AGGLOMERATION COMMUNITY OF THE LAND OF GOLD. Summary: Short Term Rental of Compaction and Vertical Loading Household Waste Dump with Crane and Kinshofer Type Hook Without Driver. Description: The Pays de l'Or agglomeration community brings together 8 municipalities in the south of Hérault, including 3 located on the Mediterranean coast: Candillargues, La Grande Motte, Lansargues, Mauguio-Carnon, Mudaison, Palavas les Flots, Saint-Aunès and Valergues. It carries out all the missions related to waste collection under management: - Door to door collection; - Collection by voluntary contribution; - Operation of recycling centers. To do this, it has a fleet of vehicles which can be increased in summer to cope with seasonal activity. Recourse to rental can also be considered in the event of prolonged immobilization of vehicles and in order to avoid any disruption in public service. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SPL SPIIT- INTERREGIONAL PUBLIC COMPANY FOR INVESTMENTS IN FAVOR OF TRANSPORT. Summary: Level 4 and Level 5 Maintenance Services (Excluding Mid-Life Operations) and Maintenance Engineering for Railway Rolling Stock. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is: (i) the performance of level 4 maintenance services (preventive and corrective) and (ii) the performance of level 4 and level 5 maintenance engineering services (excluding mid-life operations) on the railway rolling stock which will be entrusted to SPL SPIIT by the shareholder Regions. The equipment falling within the scope of the ownership of SPIIT will be made available to future Railway Operators as and when allocated by the Regions of public service operating contracts. To date, SPL SPIIT has as shareholders the Nouvelle-Aquitaine Region and the Occitanie Region, the entry of the Center Val de Loire Region into the capital of SPIIT is in progress as of the publication of the this framework agreement. SPIIT could, in the future, and during the execution of this framework agreement, be entrusted with the railway rolling stock of other Regions, if necessary, for the same objectives. "ECE D function maintenance of bogies, axles, reduction gears, electric traction motors Maintenance ECE D function of hitches, power and air production, braking system, suspension/damping valves Maintenance ECE D function of cabin and passenger air conditioning. Maintenance ECE D function of electrical engineering and electrical power Maintenance ECE function of power packs and diesel engines Maintenance engineering lot.... Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2025-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DALCIA (31). Summary: Creation and Installation of a Technical Pontoon Aimed at Pumping Water from the Adour. Description: Dalkia is awarded the creation of the boiler room and the urban heating network in the municipalities of Bayonne and Saint Pierre d'Irube. The renewable heat distributed to subscribers will come, among other things, from energy recovery on the Adour. A capture water will therefore be made to connect the boiler room to the water intake. The mission which will be entrusted to the service provider will be the design, construction and installation of a technical pontoon which will include a pumping station, and: - Using the studies carried out by the project manager, execution of execution studies - Creation of a secure technical pontoon floating on the Adour - Installation of 4 anchoring piles for the floating pontoon - Installation of two anti-jam deflectors (upstream and downstream of the pontoon) - Installation of two pumping groups on the technical pontoon. The supply of pumps will be optional. - Hydraulic connections for pumps on the HDPE DN225 network on hold, including hydraulic components (valves, valves ...) - Supply and installation of two self-cleaning strainers for the water intake and connection to the pumping groups - Installation of an electrical box, possibly with administrative formalities with ENEDIS for its connection to the public electricity network, and electrical connection of pumping groups, - Supply and configuration of remote management and remote monitoring equipment for pumping groups - Layout of.... Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Framework Agreement Relating to the Acquisition of Small Educational Leisure Equipment and Childcare Equipment for the City of Perpignan. Description: The framework agreement will be executed by the conclusion of subsequent contracts and the issuance of purchase orders under the conditions of the specifications. Each lot will be awarded separately. Services are regulated by unit prices. For the lot 1: The framework agreement will be multi-awarded. The number of operators likely to be selected is a maximum of 2 subject to a sufficient number of candidates and offers and depending on the ranking of the offers. The framework agreement will be implemented through a market subsequent annual. The subsequent annual contract will be executed by purchase orders with a maximum in application of articles L2125-1 1°, R. 2162-1 to R. 2162-6, R. 2162-13 and R. 2162-14 of the Public Order Code. For each annual period, both holders of the framework agreement will be put back into competition via the AWS platform. This competition will make it possible to determine the ranking of the holders' offers in order to be able to award the purchase orders for the year in question to the classified holder. 1st. For lot 2: The framework agreement will be single awardee. It will result in the issuance of purchase orders. The maximum annual amount for both lots is 65,000 euro(s) excluding tax The date indicated is given for information purposes only. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERCOMMUNAL COMMUNITY NORTH REUNION. Summary: Supply and Maintenance of Cinor Garbage Bins. Description: The contract consists of: FIRM SECTION: - The supply of garbage bins intended for the collection of residual household waste, recyclable waste, and bio-waste (lots 1 and 2). - Maintenance of the trash bin fleet, belonging to CINOR (lots 1 and 2). - The temporary provision of garbage bins (lots 1 and 2). - The recovery and recycling of used bins (lots 1 and 2). - Computerized management of the container fleet (lots 1 and 2). - Call management and recording, and the organization of deliveries (lots 1 and 2). OPTIONAL TRANCHES (TO): - TO NO1 (lots 1 and 2): Chipping campaigns. - TO NO2 (lots 1 and 2): Analysis and staffing surveys with a view to preventive maintenance or updating/adjustments of staffing on all or part of the park. - TO NO3 (lot 2): Supply, installation and maintenance of bio-waste bin shelters. The estimated value and the maximum value of the framework agreement mentioned in section 2.1.3 of this notice are those of the cumulative amount of lots 1 and 2 over the total duration of the contract (4 years).. Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The services will be carried out annually in two phases: installation and dismantling (including transport for lot no. 1). The duration of the contract is set at one year (2026), tacitly renewable for a period of one year. The start of the operation of seaside activities (takeaway and snacks) on the beach being set each year around March 15 until November 15, the installation of all modules must be completed at least one week before the start of the season. exploitation (projected date March 15), and removal will take place between November 2 and 15 of each year. For 2026, beach bars and restaurants must be operational by the Easter weekend at the latest, i.e. April 4, 5 and 6, 2026, this which requires the company to complete its services no later than April 3, 2026. The contract is not renewable. Variations are not permitted and there are no mandatory variations. No negotiations are planned.. Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-12. Summary: this Notice Concerns a Defense or Security Contract Aimed At: Supply of Fabrics for the Repair of Inflatable Boats of the French Armed Forces.. Description: It is a framework agreement: single beneficiary which includes:<br> - a firm share;<br> - one or more optional tranche(s) in application of articles R. 2313-2, R. 2391-8 to R. 239110 of the public procurement code, according to the terms explained in the consultation file;<br> - a portion of vouchers order in accordance with the provisions of article R. 2362-8 of the public procurement code;<br> - a portion of orders for supplies or services intended to cover possible technical hazards in application of articles R. 2372-19 to R. 2372-21 of the public procurement code.<br> The draft agreement framework aims to participate in maintaining in operational condition the inflatable boats in service in the French armed forces.<br> Its purpose is the supply of coated textile supports intended for the repair of the floats of semi-rigid inflatable boats of brands Zodiac Milpro, Sillinger, Zeppelin and Arimar.<br> Supply of fabrics for the repair of inflatable boats of the French armed forces.<br> This notice concerns a submission of applications for a single-awardee framework agreement project whose objective is to participate in maintaining the condition operational of inflatable boats in service in the French armed forces.<br> Its purpose is to supply coated textile supports intended for repairing the floats of semi-rigid inflatable boats of the Zodiac Milpro, Sillinger, Zeppelin and Arim.. Published Date: 2025-12-10. Closing Date: 2026-01-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Published Date: 2025-12-10. Closing Date: 2026-01-16. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
